timeline.author: wirtsleg

timeline.body:
This test has a lot of strange logic.

1. Fills cache with unique and non-unique elements without any reason
2. Checks for saving without id

In my opinion, it should just check repository bean is not null and do 1 put, 1 get (just in case).
timeline.bodyText:
This test has a lot of strange logic.

Fills cache with unique and non-unique elements without any reason
Checks for saving without id

In my opinion, it should just check repository bean is not null and do 1 put, 1 get (just in case).
timeline.bodyHTML:
This test has a lot of strange logic.

  1. Fills cache with unique and non-unique elements without any reason
  2. Checks for saving without id

In my opinion, it should just check repository bean is not null and do 1 put, 1 get (just in case).
timeline.author: wirtsleg

timeline.message: GG-31881 [IGNITE-12582] Add Spring EL support in Spring Data.

timeline.bodyHTML:
Let's simplify this test a bit.

Suggested change
@Test
public void testFailIfSaveWithoutId() {
assertNotNull(repo);
Person person = new Person("some_name", "some_surname");
try {
repo.save(person);
fail("Managed to save a Person without ID");
}
catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
//excepted
}
@Test(expected = UnsupportedOperationException.class)
public void testFailIfSaveWithoutId() {
assertNotNull(repo);
Person person = new Person("some_name", "some_surname");
repo.save(person);
